p: Once all risks along NBM life cycle have been assessed, adequate measures to avoid or limit/control these risks must be identified to ensure safer production, handling and disposal of NBMs. The traditional risk management of chemical substances applies to the NBMs used in medical sector. It relies on the implementation of safe-by-design and risk reduction and control measures based on the hierarchy of controls (e.g., NIOSH 2013 [ 102]), following the so-called STOP principle: substitution, technical measures, organisational measures and personal protection measures which can be applied throughout the life cycle of a specific material.
